title: Differences That Matter: Auditing Models for Capability Gap Discovery and Rectification
summary: AuditDM introduces an automated framework that leverages reinforcement learning to train an MLLM as an auditor, generating challenging questions and counterfactual images designed to maximize disagreement among target models. This process effectively discovers significant, interpretable capability gaps and failure modes, which are then used as annotation-free data to rectify the models, leading to substantial performance improvements and enabling smaller models to outperform larger ones.

title: Training Together, Diagnosing Better: Federated Learning for Collagen VI-Related Dystrophies
summary: This paper presents a groundbreaking application of Federated Learning (FL) to address the diagnostic challenges of rare diseases, specifically collagen VI-related dystrophies (COL6-RD), where data scarcity and privacy hinder traditional ML approaches. By enabling collaborative model training across decentralized datasets from two international organizations using the Sherpa.ai platform, the researchers developed an ML model that accurately classifies COL6-RD pathogenic mechanisms from immunofluorescence images. This FL-driven model achieved a superior F1-score of 0.82, significantly outperforming isolated institutional models and demonstrating enhanced diagnostic utility and generalizability.

title: The Social Responsibility Stack: A Control-Theoretic Architecture for Governing Socio-Technical AI
summary: Artificial intelligence systems are increasingly deployed in domains that shape human behaviour, institutional decision-making, and societal outcomes. Existing responsible AI and governance efforts provide important normative principles but often lack enforceable engineering mechanisms that operate ...

title: Can plants grow on the Moon and Mars: seed germination enhancement using magnesium oxide coated halloysite nanotubes (MgO HNTs)
summary: This study demonstrates that magnesium oxide coated halloysite nanotubes (MgO HNTs) significantly enhance seed germination and early plant development across terrestrial soil simulants and challenging lunar and Martian regolith analogs. The research identified optimal conditions for MgO HNT application, highlighting its potential as a nanomaterial amendment for sustainable food cultivation in both Earth and space environments, particularly critical for long-duration human missions.
domains: Environmental Health (indirectly, via nanomaterial safety considerations)

title: Feasibility of Radio Frequency Based Wireless Sensing of Lead Contamination in Soil
summary: This paper introduces SoilScanner, a novel radio frequency (RF)-based wireless system designed for the rapid detection of lead (Pb) contamination in soil, addressing the limitations of current labor-intensive and costly methods. The system leverages the discovery that different salts, including lead compounds, distinctively affect radio signal propagation patterns across various frequencies. SoilScanner demonstrated 72% accuracy in classifying soil samples into low-Pb and high-Pb categories (with a 200 ppm threshold), crucially avoiding misclassification for any samples exceeding 500 ppm Pb, thereby proving the feasibility of developing portable and affordable Pb detection devices.

title: A Multi-Agent Large Language Model Framework for Automated Qualitative Analysis
summary: This study introduces CoTI, a multi-agent Large Language Model (LLM) framework designed to automate qualitative thematic analysis, addressing its traditional labor-intensive and subjective nature. Applied to heart failure patient interviews, CoTI generated key phrases, themes, and a codebook that closely aligned with a senior investigator's analysis, outperforming both junior investigators and baseline NLP models.

title: Lifting Biomolecular Data Acquisition
summary: One strategy to scale up ML-driven science is to increase wet lab experiments' information density. We present a method based on a neural extension of compressed sensing to function space.
